content.description:
This good warmup is located near the left side of the patina-covered east face.

Sit start at a good sidepull and climb up and right using cracks in the patina to the juggy lip. Drop off.

Start on 1 of 2 big flakes at head height.  Crux is the first move up to a smallish crimp. Stick this and screw up the courage for the long haul to the top. Reachy moves between small sidepulls and gastons leads you straight up and over the bulge (at about 30 feet).  Scary!!
content.protection: Pads, but a fall from the top will still leave you a cripple.
content.location: Just right of Lidijia's Mouth. I think the starting jug on the left is broken.  Right jug is huge and well chalked up.  Easy to spot.

content.description:
Really good technical Buttermilk movement on small crack-like patina crimps, with some slightly glassy foot holds.

Sit start on a lefthand sidepull crimp and pull onto the wall moving to a right hand undercling. From here continue up the clean fractured face on bulletproof holds.

Just right of Snake Oil, this line follows jugs straight up to the highest lip, then traverses left and up more big plates.  Generally used as the downclimb for other routes that top out the Lidija boulder.

Pull into the left side of the mouth, moving straight up to a crimp above the lip instead of traversing rightward. Continue straight up using crimps and slopers, avoiding the flake/patina to the left. Follow lower angle climbing to the summit.
content.location: East face of the Lidija Boulder.

content.description: Sit start and make a hard move. Follow patina up and right then drop off.
content.location: On the far left side of the Patina filled face. To left of Wanderlust, finishes on same jugs.

content.description:
The dyno testpiece of the area, other than Suspended in Silence atleast...

Stand start on two good sidepulls, pull on and find the feet you want. From here look up and you will see a giant flake jug at the lip about 5 feet away. Launch up the vertical face and snag the lip with one or both hands. Top out on jugs. Not to be underestimated.
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads. The swing isn't too big once you snag it because the face is fairly vertical.
content.location: Around the corner to the left of Lidija's Mouth. Easiest way to locate it is by the jugs on the lip.

content.description: This is one heck of a highball. Climb the middle of the SW face. The crux is at a reasonable height and the holds just get bigger the higher you climb.
